1.q_string: Two different metal rods of the same length have their ends kept at the temperatures \(\theta_{1}\) and \(\theta_{2}\). with \(\theta_{2}>\theta_{1}\). If \(A_{1}\) and \(A_{2}\) are their cross-sectional areas and \(k_{1}\) and \(k_{2}\) are their thermal conductivities, then the rate of flow of heat in the two rods will be the same if:

Metallic spheres \(S_{1}\) and \(S_{2}\) are made of the same material and have identical surface finish. The mass of \(S _{1}\) is three times that of \(S _{2}\). Both the spheres are heated to the same high temperature and placed in the same room which has lower temperature, but are thermally insulated from each other. The ratio of the initial rate of cooling of \(S_{1}\) to that of \(S _{2}\) is:

q_option: All will cool at the same rate.
1.q_string: A sphere, a cube and a thin circular plate all are made of same material having same mass. They are initially heated to \(200^{\circ} C\). Which of these will cool the fastest?
A body cools from \(75^{\circ} C\) to \(65^{\circ} C\) in \(5\) minutes in a room where the temperature is \(25^{\circ} C\). The temperature of the body at the end of the next \(5\) minutes will be:

q_option: All will glow with equal brightness
1.q_string: Three objects coloured black, gray, and white can withstand hostile conditions up to \(2800^{\circ} C\). These objects are thrown into a furnace, where each of them attains a temperature of \(2000^{\circ} C\). Which object will glow the brightest?
Which of the following laws states that good absorbers of heat are good emitters?
Hot water cools from \(60^{\circ} C\) to \(50^{\circ} C\) in the first \(10\) minutes and from \(50^{\circ} C\) to \(42^{\circ} C\) in the next \(10\) minutes. The temperature of the surroundings is:

Five rods of the same dimensions are arranged as shown in the figure. They have thermal conductivity. When points A and B are maintained at different temperatures, no heat flows through the central rod if:
One filament takes \(10\) minutes to heat a kettle, and another takes \(15\) minutes if connected in parallel. When used together, they will take ____ minutes to heat the same kettle.

A cylinder of radius \(R\), made of a material of thermal conductivity \(k _{1}\), is surrounded by a cylindrical sheet of inner radius \(R\) and outer radius \(2 R\), made of a material of thermal conductivity \(k _{2}\). The two ends of the combined system are maintained at two different temperatures. There is no loss of heat across the cylindrical surface and the system is in steady state. Calculate the effective thermal conductivity of the system.
A black body has maximum wavelength \(\lambda_{{m}}\) at \(2000 {K}\). Its corresponding wavelength at \(3000 {K}\) will be:

Steam at \(373 K\) is passed through a tube of radius \(10 cm\) and length \(2 m\). If the thickness of the tube is \(5 mm\) and the thermal conductivity of the material is \(390 W m ^{-1} K ^{-1}\), calculate the heat lost per second. The outside temperature is \(0^{\circ} C\).
The surface temperature of the sun, which has maximum energy emission at \(500 nm\) is \(6000 K\). The temperature of a star, which has maximum energy emission at \(400 nm\), will be:
A black body is heated from \(27^{\circ} C\) to \(927^{\circ} C\). The ratio of radiations emitted at the two temperatures will be:
If the temperature of the sun was to increase from \(T\) to \(2 T\) and its radius from \(R\) to \(2 R\), then how many times will the radiant energy be received on the earth?
